hanzi-su-wiki:
糾

Значения

Скручивать; соединять; разузнавать; сложный, запутанный

Мнемоника

Скручиваться или обвивать как хмель (справа) или нитка 糸.

Варианты

纠, 糺
purpleculture_pinyin:
jiū
to gather together; to investigate; to entangle; to correct
собираться вместе; исследовать; запутывать; исправлять
rtega_mnemonic:
糾糾RS
纠纠		investigate, inspect, entangle, involve
  • RS. entangle 丩 with a string 糸
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 纠)
Ideographic: To connect 丩 threads 糹; 丩 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
糾紛 [ jiū fēn ]: dispute
糾正 [ jiū zhèng ]: to correct; to make right
糾纏 [ jiū chán ]: to be in a tangle; to nag
糾葛 [ jiū gé ]: entanglement; dispute
糾集 [ jiū jí ]: to gather together; to muster
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 丩 [ jiū ] to connect, to join; vine
heisig_chinese_memo: A Pepsi promotion where you twist off the cap to find pictures of your favorite heroes entangled with each other like Spiderman or members of the Fantastic Four.
koohiiStory1: A cornucopia is a twisted goat's horn decorated with coloured threads.
koohiiStory2: [twist; ask; investigate; verify] Stories full of twists are difficult to write, because of the cornucopia of threads the author has to manage.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Thread and vines alone are too weak to hold anything up. You need to twist them together to make them strong.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine twisting some threads and vines together. Feel them and twist the two tighter together.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: As you twist the thread and vines together, suddenly you feel a lump. You look down and see a cucumber (きゅう) twisted into it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: It turns out those vines you were twisting were cucumber vines! Yum!
Ru_Notes: Сравни: 叫 (さけぶ、キョウ крик)
Ru_Radicals: ｜, 十 (десять), 小 (маленький), 幺 (короткая нить), 糸 (нить)
Ru_trainchinese: jiū: (графема) исправлять, корректировать; держать вместе; обматывать, перевязывать; держать под контролем
Kanshudo_mnemonic: to connect (丩) the thread (糸) you twist it
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A cornucopia of threads is inevitably going to get entangled at some point.
humanum_short_description_en: The seal script of the word " correction " changes from "糸" to "丩", and "丩" is also marked. From " Shito " represents the wire rope or related to the " Jiu " means entangled shrouded meaning, it is " correct " when the original meaning of the word is twisted rope or wire, after the idea was stalking, entangled meaning. See " sentence ".
humanum_short_description: 「糾」字的篆文從「糸」從「丩」，「丩」亦標聲。從「糸」表示與繩或絲有關，從「丩」表示糾纏繚繞的意思，故「糾」字本義當為絞合的繩或絲，後引申為纏擾、糾纏的意思。參見「句」。

糾字的基本解释

糾
jiū
见“纠”。

糾字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiū］
［《廣韻》居黝切，上黝，見。］
亦作“糺1”。“纠1”的繁体字。
(1)绞合的绳索。
(2)缠绕；纠缠。
(3)聚合；收集。
(4)特指强制征集。
(5)纠正；矫正。
(6)督察；督责。
(7)举发；惩治。
(8)恭敬。
(9)急戾。
(10)揪，抓。
[②]［jiǎo］
［《集韻》舉夭切，上小，見。］
“纠2”的繁体字。
见“窈糾”。

糾字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　糾； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页915第08
【廣韻】居黝切【集韻】吉酉切，?音朻。【說文】繩三合也。【史記·賈誼傳】何異糾纆。【註】《通俗文》云：合繩曰糾。　又【博雅】舉也。【書·囧命】繩愆糾謬。【疏】糾，謂發舉其愆過。【左傳·昭六年】糾之以政。【註】糾，舉也。　又【周禮·天官·大宰】以糾萬民。【釋文】糾，察也。又【小宰】凡宮之糾禁。【註】糾，猶割也，察也。　又【詩·魏風】糾糾葛屨。【傳】猶繚繚也。【疏】稀疏之貌。　又【後漢·公孫瓚傳】糾人完聚。【註】糾，收也。　又【後漢·荀彧傳】收離糾散。【註】糾，合也。又【玉篇】告也。【廣韻】督也，參也，急也，戾也。　又【集韻】舉夭切，音矯。【詩·陳風】舒窈糾兮。【傳】窈糾，舒之姿也。　又【正韻】舉有切，音九。義同。　又【韻補】叶居由切，結也。【嵆康·琴賦】瀄汨澎湃，䖤蟺相糾。放肆大川，濟乎中州。　【正字通】俗從斗作紏，非。○按《說文》糾在丩部，今倂入。

[①]［jiū］

Also known as "糺1". Traditional Chinese characters for "Correction 1".
(1) Stranded rope.
(2) Entanglement; entanglement.
(3) Aggregation; collection.
(4) Specifically refers to compulsory collection.
(5) Correction; correction.
(6) Inspector; Inspector.
(7) Reporting; punishment.
(8) Respectfully.
(9) Urgent.
(10) Pull, grab.
[②]［jiǎo］
["Ji Yun" Ju Yao cut, Shang Xiao, see you. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "Correction 2".
See "Rectification".

jiū, jiǎo
вм. 纠
Radicals: 糸, 丩  (thread, vines)
Meaning Mnemonic
Thread and vines alone are too weak to hold anything up. You need to twist them together to make them strong.
Imagine twisting some threads and vines together. Feel them and twist the two tighter together.
Reading Mnemonic
As you twist the thread and vines together, suddenly you feel a lump. You look down and see a cucumber (きゅう) twisted into it.
It turns out those vines you were twisting were cucumber vines! Yum!
